website_summaries.verdict: A great, affordable standard keyboard that also comes with a mouse.
pros: Lasts a long time even with daily use
cons: Keys can feel a little mushy

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality keyboard/mouse set
customer_reviews.text: For Logitech this is a surprisingly bad quality set. It's very inexpensive, which is probably all that matters for this set. The keyboard is so cheap that you can actually bend it in the middle. The mouse is very cheap, but it does work. Avoid this set. If you're looking for a cheaper combo, that isn't awful, try the MK345 instead:  Yes, it's twice the cost, but it's so worth the extra price. It's not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and perfect for the price, would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These actually work great and the quality is great for the price. I purchased 2 of these for each of our computers and they work perfectly and are very comfortable to use. I thought they may be poor quality because of the price but was very pleasantly surprised, they look and work great. I would recommend these highly...
customer_reviews.author: Charlieboy's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap keyboard + mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard to keep at my parents' house when I visit here/get stuck due to a pandemic. I'm using it with my Macbook Pro, and it works great. The windows key works as the Apple command key, and having the extra numberpad on the side is nice. I wouldn't call it sleek, but it's not as bulky as I was expecting. Only complaint is that the keys when typing and scroll wheel on the mouse are very loud, but overall this is a great option for the price. I will update this review if I run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, works well
customer_reviews.text: A good standard keyboard and mouse set. It does what I want it to do. No point paying lots more $$ for exactly the same features! This one works well and does the job. Our whole family uses it on our shared computer, and kids and adults alike have no problems using it. The keys (even the special keys etc) are exactly where I'd expect to find them - I had been using another keyboard before - so there was nothing unusual or weird about this one, no quirks. Definitely recommended if you're looking for a good quality keyboard at an affordable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ver_C

customer_reviews.title: It was what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got a computer with no wife (how can you sell a computer with no wifi in 2020? (beware of Groupon by the way) for that very reason. I got a new wifi card today and installed it but my keyboard and mouse are the same ones I'm posting about and typing on. I love them both. Hardwired yes but now I have options. Anyway, There is the keyboard thingy if you can type where they throw an extra key near the 'return' key and I hate that, that is why I got this one. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Opened product with no mouse included
customer_reviews.text: The item was shipped with the shipping label attached to the product's box, without any additional packaging. It was clearly opened and returned by another customer before being shipped to me. The old shipping label was still attached to the corner of the box. When I opened it the mouse was missing. I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Bad mouse and keyboard set
customer_reviews.text: We bought almost 20 of these and immediately had problems with a few of the mice and keyboards. Every week a few more have problems :( * Mouse doesn't move well. * Left, right, or both mouse buttons stop working. * Scroll wheel problems. * Mouse not recognized. * Keyboard feet break. * Keyboard keys are mushy, especially spacebar. We're going to have to replace all of these. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: IT Team

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard went kaput QUICKLY after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard because I blindly trust the manufacturer. How hard, really, can a keyboard be to deal with? I tell you that within two months, ALL kinds of bizarre things happened to it when I"d hit the keys, making it absolutely dysfunctional. I either WANT MY MONEY BACK, or receive a replacement keyboard (ONE WHICH ACTUALLY WORKS) to resolve this issue. I need it handled ASAP. I'm a writer...this is THE tool of my trade. I'm disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Bastedo

customer_reviews.title: Great for a while...
customer_reviews.text: These keyboards are fine and will serve you well. The problem I encountered is that the lettering on the keys faded almost instantly, and disappeared in the case of some letters. This obviously made it difficult to use, especially when more than one was smudged off. It's an odd oversight by the otherwise good company with its skein of good products.
customer_reviews.author: Beantown Jim

customer_reviews.title: Hardware fault after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my home desktop (writing/internet mostly) and ended up using it for gaming. The key press is pretty mushy but expected from a super cheap, non-mechanical keyboard and the symbols on the keys were wearing off on the WASD and homekeys within a few weeks of use. After 1.8yrs of steady use, the hardware started failing. Keys would register as being held down regardless if I was not pressing them or repeatedly pressing them in a frantic attempt to reset it. This is super frustrating when typing and even more so in games when it would be my WASD keys trying to walk me off a map. Won't be buying another logitech keyboard in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Just fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. It isn't flashy but it hasn't broken. I will say, however, that you should check your state surplus before buying (unless you like the comfort of online) because I found a nearly identical keyboard to this today for literally $2 brand new! Kansas, you waste money like crazy. Why do state departments pad out their budget needs by buying items over-priced or way too plentiful just so they don't lose their allocated budget when they really need it? Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Huff

customer_reviews.title: affordable keyboard that failed after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for a computer build I made about 2 months ago. I have had good experience with Logitech products before but unfortunately this time around it was different. The space key on the keyboard is already failing, which means if I press anywhere other than the centre of the key, it does not register. And you can here the spring making an abnormal sound which tells me the spring has failed. I don't know if one should expect more from such a cheap product, but I am not happy that it failed so soon. I was hoping it would last 1 year at least.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to reduce emf (electromagnetic field) radiation from my laptop and this was suggested, along with a grounding wire. The keyboard lets me spread out my hands instead of cramping them up close to type on the laptop. That makes a difference when I'm using it for hours. So I appreciate the room. I had one of these (Logitech) keyboards for my old desktop so this is an upgrade. I am really happy with it and recommend it. I shopped for deals and this was the best deal for the set.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works.  Always.
customer_reviews.text: Other than for gamers, and perhaps even the "tech elite," I can't imagine why anyone would buy anything but this simple, reliable and easy to use keyboard. It's a logitech. Not to base my review on a brand, but I've probably bought over 1,000 of them for my business entities and they just work. Other than due to my own violent rage at my computer, I've never had one break. They don't lag, the button layout is what any computer user would expect and the tactile response is very gratifying. This really is a given for me. I'll buy many more in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fogleman

customer_reviews.title: Great Ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Everything that Logitech says about this keyboard is true: Its ergonomics make typing very comfortable: good key spacing, low profile keys, bright white font on the black keys for good contrast. No "clacking" while you type. This keyboard is relatively quiet (which I love!). I have owned several wireless keyboards that go wacky after a couple of months, so I switch back to a wired keyboard and am very happy! It also helps that it is slightly spill resistant. I haven't met a family where the occasional spill near the computer hasn't happened. Another pro is the price. Can't beat it! System: Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.author: K. Newland

customer_reviews.title: A Great, Basic Wired Keyboard and Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm using them both right now. The keys on the keyboard feel fine with a good distance for each key press. The mouse is basic, no side buttons, the wheel has a very tight and precise feel. It's good. The original reason I purchased this was so I would have a wired keyboard and mouse for building a computer. Blue tooth devices can be a problem when you first boot a newly built computer. I'll probably eventually get a set of Bluetooth accessories, but I'll keep these for when you can't use blue tooth. Recommendation? Get these if you want a wired set. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewX

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Ok, remember back when you would buy a mouse and keyboard and they were sturdy, dependable and didn’t feel awkward or like some kind of toy? Well, this is just that. The keybord and mouse style we adults remember and love! Sturdy, full size and great to use for ANY task. The packaging when it arrived was simple, just its normal retail boxing (check out photo) but, unlike others’ ours arrived well and in tact. So, if you’re thinking on whether to buy or not, just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: ACES717

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, responsive, decent pricing, perfect for home or office
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a solid wired keyboard and mouse combo that's decently priced (wireless doesn't work for me). This is it. Typing is much easier than on my laptop. The keys make some noise, but that doesn't bother me. The mouse is precise, with good right / left clicks without making too much noise. The size of the mouse is about right for small hands. The wheel scrolls nicely. At $15, this is a steal. I use it with my laptop + external monitor (for working from home). Very satisfied. Now I'm waiting to see how long it lasts. I might get another set for the office.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: I am a logitech fan!
customer_reviews.text: Mostly every thing I own for my computer is logitech. From this keyboard to the speakers, the mouse & the webcam (tripod it stands on is polaroid..and I love that too..I've had it for a few years now). There isn't really a whole lot that I can say about the keyboard except that I love the design. Great for the price and of course, does everything I need it to do. If I need to replace this one, chances are, I will be looking for another logitech! Nothing fancy or anything, it's just a 'simple' keyboard that does everything I need it to do. :0)
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: It is a keyboard and mouse combo. I didn't expect anything else.
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid keyboard. I have used this model and type before. The price was good and it came with a mouse. Shipping: Seller shipped the doggone keyboard in the manufacturers box (with nothing to protect it). The mouse appears to have be stomped and the cable pulled out of it. I do not blame the seller for the damage as they most likely didn't expect Bigfoot to appear at the USPS distribution center and curb stomp this package. Perhaps food for thought USPS isn't taking care of our packages and there is a reason there are memes poking fun at them.
customer_reviews.author: Joey P. Goyette

customer_reviews.title: No mouse included!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this since I’m working from home bc of Covid-19. My kids also needed this so they can log in to their school & do schoolwork. The box it was delivered in looked like it went through a WWE Royal Rumble match. There was literally NOTHING inside to ensure the product would not be damaged. I’ve worked logistics/freight - I know that a only thin plastic sleeve on the keyboard just won’t cut it! On top of this, there was no mouse included. I ordered this bc it is a keyboard/mouse combo. Kind of pointless without a mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible keyboard, Annoying mouse
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Logitech. That's why I bought this. I wish I hadn't. The letters on the keyboard wore off very quickly, making it practically useless. The mouse I hate. The lighting is so annoying and you have to set up a bad program to turn it off (why is it on by default?) and set that program to run at start up, and it sometimes loads "updates" (to a mouse?!) that take over your computer when you're trying to use another program.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard out there for us really old users.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes great keyboards (and mice). This is my second one of this model. The first one lasted almost five years and I do a LOT of typing every day. My hands know exactly where to go on this traditional 101 key keyboard so I don't feel like relearning on the new styles. If you're old like me you'll appreciate this traditional layout.
customer_reviews.author: 2old2work

customer_reviews.title: Great value keyboard set!
customer_reviews.text: Up front, I only bought this to use for bios settings as a wireless keyboard can’t do that. It’s not ergonomically awesome, but for my purpose worked great. Works with Mac and PC. This kit ended up being only $3 more than buying a (no name brand) keyboard alone locally.
customer_reviews.author: gaterose

customer_reviews.title: Logitech quality!
customer_reviews.text: When you need a no nonsense keyboard and mouse, Logitech Desktop MK120 fits the bill. The keyboard is comfortable for typing on 8 hours a day, 5 days a week and stands the test of time. Between the Logitech MK120 and Microsoft's least expensive KB/Mouse combo, its a tough choice....both affordable offerings. This is a great combo for people working in a home office, which is why I purchased. Easy to install, easy to use, and economical. Logitech makes some awesome products and remains a cutting edge company.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Keybroard is a little small, but solid! Mouse is a mouse (is a mouse)
customer_reviews.text: This one really does not need a whole lot of review writin' The keyboard is an outstanding inexpensive keyboard. It works, but not really that great for someone with normal to large hands. Small hands rejoice! This is your no-frills keyboard. Mouse is solid, feels well constructed and works perfectly. Even with long term use. Honestly, worth the money. (And no one even paid me to say that!)
customer_reviews.author: Marsaeus

customer_reviews.title: Wireless keyboard is a must for laptops
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I needed to elevate my laptop for viewing and it became uncomfortable to type. This keyboard is wireless and was setup with a few minutes. It's made life so much easier! I haven't switched it off and the battery is still good after a month (AA batteries).
customer_reviews.author: MBJ in Philly

customer_reviews.title: Occasionally Sticks But Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: My laptop keyboard layout does not follow normal ones - the Fn button is to the left of the Ctrl key. I always press Fn accidentally while trying to do a copy and paste (Ctrl-C and Ctrl-V). This external keyboard solves the problem. Although, I've noticed that the keyboard sticks occasionally. It could be latency issue or I just type too fast. I use it every single day and it's still chugging along. And, yes, it does come with a logictech USB mouse as well.
customer_reviews.author: LOU A.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in perfect condition. I have been using Logitech peripherals since the early 1990s because they LAST and i have never had a problem with any Logitech product. I am typing this review on this keyboard as we speak :) Would definitely buy again and definitely recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: ClareDeLune

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard seems fine, mouse D.O.A.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and the keyboard works great. Def like better than the one I was replacing. But the mouse was broken on arrival. The box wasn't damaged at all, so it must have been packaged that way from the manufacturer. That's pretty bad quality control! Under stay-at-home orders right now and wasn't that expensive so I won't bother trying to return this. My old mouse has been working for five years, I'm sure it'll hold up a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: JaneColorado

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging and missing stuff
customer_reviews.text: The mouse was missing and the package was not secured very well. I understand these arw strange times but this is for my work. A replacement mouse would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Lewis

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH TYPING!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this keyboard! I love the design. It's as if it was made for me only. This keyboard is allowing me to speed type with ease. The weight of the keyboard is perfect... not light as a feather! My old keyboard was so light it would slide all over the place. This is a simple keyboard - no supernatural bells or whistles... just a solid, simple, steady keyboard. The keypads are spaced perfect for me. Also, the shipping was super quick - arrived a day early! Thank you Logitech and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Stone

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard stopped working 2 months after I bought it. Do not buy and do not waste your money on this junk!
customer_reviews.author: ErinY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price and simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I had this combo for a while now. No complaints, does everything it needs to do for Keyboard and mouse. Great price for a combo pack which I needed. Will buy again if needed. I don't expect any tech to last more then 3 years so I will buy from LogiTech for upgraded keyboard and mouse combo's in the future. Hopefully next Mouse has more buttons like the Apple Mouse, I like those side buttons to switch from any program that is up if needed. But ohwell!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Greaves

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat the Value
customer_reviews.text: It works! I had a wireless keyboard and wired mouse that had issues. I wanted to buy a set that worked and that was not cheaply made. This is perfect, I have had for a month and I am so happy with it. The materials feels like it resists oily skin, which is great for gaming, and extended use. It doesn't have any of the special things more expensive keyboard and mice have, like additional buttons, lcd screens, lights, etc. But it does everything you need from a keyboard and mouse at a great price. Highly recommend to anyone looking for an affordable keyboard and mouse pair that is not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer1317

customer_reviews.title: Logitech MK120 Keyboard Review
customer_reviews.text: This is a good keyboard to learn to touch-type with, but only seems sufficient for temporary use. If you're looking for something for long-term use, you'd probably be better off with a different keyboard; in this case, you get what you pay for. Pro: Good price for beginners ($17-18) Con: Some keys seem to need extra pressure while typing - one in particular for me is the 'A' key.
customer_reviews.author: Tyesha

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I have never been had a positive experience with a Logitech product. But i wasn't looking for gold. All I needed was a cheap mouse & keyboard for my son to use at school. Surely Logitech could manage that much? Nope. The wire on the mouse was lodged in between the chassis & the left click on of the mouse, keeping the button from being pressed at all. It's broken & useless.
customer_reviews.author: Markus Greystone

customer_reviews.title: How is no one talking about the space bar
customer_reviews.text: the space bar does not move down "as one unit" like other better keyboards. It kind of pivots around the center of the space bar, so that when you try to enter a space by pressing on the sides, it's almost impossible to type a space unless you very forcefully press down. This was so frustrating to me that I think I might return the keyboard on the day that I received it...
customer_reviews.author: Derek Xiao

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive combo that works reliably
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a usb attached mouse and keyboard for a specific task. Logitech was the best budget combo that I could find. I have had good luck with their products and even though this is an economical set, it worked reliably. Can’t rate it for gaming or volume control, as I didn’t use it for those applications but as a keyboard mouse combo it did everything that I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Handyandy

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is an excellent, basic one. Works well and is a good size. The mouse is also a basic mouse, but does the job. Only 1 minor complaint, and that is that the Caps Lock doesn't light up when I hit it. Sometimes I hit is without realizing I have because there's no light. Not a big drawback, though. Perfect for the price, I recommend this keyboard and mouse set.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. F.

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 this time and they are going back.
customer_reviews.text: I can not even see the keys on this keyboard. The keyboard is dark and the letters are an off white and it makes it difficult to tell which letter and which function. The second day the legs that hold the keyboard up broke off. This is about the 8th keyboard I have purchased and this time...disappointed. Not completely as described.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: The key pressure of this keyboard is just right.
customer_reviews.text: As I stated above, the key stroke pressure is just right. I was pounding on my old [five or more year old ], keyboard. My typing speed was very slow. Now I am building up typing speed again. Not that it matters when most typing is done on a hunt and peck keyboard. When I am at my PC at the desk, I want a wonderful keyboard. This one is doing a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new keyboard for my desktop because mine was sticky and full of crumbs I couldn't get out. I purchased this one because it offered what I needed for a reasonable price and it came quickly. Very easy to plug in and it worked immediately. Have not needed the mouse yet but keeping for future use. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, nice feel and travel on the keys, mouse feels nice too.
customer_reviews.text: Solid build, nice feel and travel on the keys, mouse feels nice too. It’s just a keyboard and mouse yes, but anyone who’s used a lousy keyboard knows they’re not all the same, this one feels similar to the plain old run of the mill Dell keyboard I use for my other computer This Logitech works with my Mac, the windows key is mapped as the apple key
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER ZGURIS

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate simple high-value keyboard/mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something inexpensive but functional and durable and pleasant to use. That's exactly what I got! I'm using them both with my Macbook Pro to WFH without any connectivity issues or problems. Pro tip: if you're looking for your missing COMMAND button, it's the Windows button.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this to plug into my laptop while working from home these days - it allows me to have a more productive work experience, as I plug these and an external 2nd monitor into my laptop. The products are both fine - they feel basic but not flimsy or cheap. Three weeks in, using them all day every day, and not a problem in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: good keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is good for the $15 price, mouse doesn't work without a pad. Received what I ordered and it was worth it, but recognized shortly thereafter that with as much time as I spend on the computer for work, I want the best keyboard and mouse I can find. I expect both the keyboard and mouse will end up reliable backups for what I have on order.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Touch Typists Want Keyboards with Texture
customer_reviews.text: We buy a lot of HP Envy desktops which come with wireless keyboards with featureless keys, all identical in size and shape; chiclet keyboards. They are AWFUL for anyone who actually knows how to type. Every key feels the same. We immediately replace those awful keyboards with these Logitech keyboards that feel great and don't require batteries. These aren't the best keyboards but, for about $15, they are a bazillion times better than what comes with the HP Envy desktops.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L Steinhoff

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Wired KB/Mouse Combo
customer_reviews.text: Received a bundle of these to replace some older keyboards and mice in the office. Great value keyboard / mouse bundle. Keyboard Pro's: Fairly quiet keys. I type fast and hard, and can't stand a loud keyboard at work! Windows key on both sides of space: Great for shortcuts "normal" key placement - backspace size, etc. Everything is where it should be. Decently long cable - docking station is on the other side of the desk for some folks, longer cable is nice Mouse Pro's: Slides well, responsive. Scroll wheel has the rubbery clicks for feedback Light, good shape for lefties or righties General Con's: Mouse could use a back button No media controls on keyboard (don't want/use much)
customer_reviews.author: C. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry-Level Combo
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for a light-use desktop computer. We have several computer workstations in our house for kids to use for homework. For one location, we don't expect heavy use and, thus, didn't want to spend a lot of money. For the low price, this keyboard/mouse combo is perfect. If we needed something for extended, heavy daily use, I would probably have spent a little more money on something that feels more solid. But, this combo is fine and seems like good quality for an entry-level price point.
customer_reviews.author: Sail Away

customer_reviews.title: No Mouse
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is as expected, but it seems to be a return or something. The box was open and banged up and there was no mouse included at all. Truthfully, I only needed the keyboard so I didn't go through the hassle of returning it, but the fact that I only received part of what I purchased is pretty ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a cheap mouse/keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, no issues. It is a cheap mouse/keyboard combo made for everyday PC use. If it lasts a few years I'd feel like I got my money's worth out of it. Shipping was another matter. Whomever shipped it just sent it out in the kb/mouse box itself. One end was NOT sealed and came without the mouse inside it. The keyboard was undamaged however and Amazon got a replacement to me in 2 days without any other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought a “gaming” keyboard recently that had stiff keys that stay stuck up and don’t press, which is not acceptable for LoL that requires fast reflexes. I bought this keyboard with little expectations, but I was very impressed at how easy the keys were to press. I just plugged it and it was good to go, keys were responsive and does what I need it to do. Highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is some click noise when pressing the keys---gives me feedback that I have pressed a key. But it isn't loud by any means. Connectivity is never a problem since it is wired, and I don't need to move it so it's fine. There is no consideration for ergonomics but for the price, is can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Jean

customer_reviews.title: I love this set!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second keyboard and mouse combo by this maker. I wore off the original letters on the keyboard after a couple years use. I was pleased to purchase another!
customer_reviews.author: Debra M. Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KEYBOARD TERRIBLE MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I HAD THE 120 KEYBOARD FOR YEARS AND HAD TO REPLACE BECAUSE SOME OF THE KEYS WHERE STICKING. THIS WAS JUST DO TO NORMAL USE AND SOMETIME DIRTY HANDS. SO I DECIDED TO GET ANOTHER. THE OFFER WAS WITH OR WITHOUT A MOUSE. AND FOR UNDER $5 DECIDED TO ADD MICKY. THE MOUSE AFTER 5 MINUTES WAS ENOUGH AND REINSTALLED OLD GE MOUSE. THE WHEEL IS NOT ONLY NOT SMOOTH BUT IS NOISY. IT FUNCTIONS BUT THE WHEEL IS ALSO NOT RESPONSIVE WHEN YOU CHANGE DIRECTIONS. THE OPTIC PART IS FINE.
customer_reviews.author: olderthandirt

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for the price. My wife's old keyboard was starting to not be responsive on some keys. I purchased this replacement based strictly on the brand name and price and was pleasantly surprised. My wife loves the responsiveness of the keys, she does not have to use much pressure to get them to respond. I will buy this again whenever I need another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Koz

customer_reviews.title: Makes working from home easier
customer_reviews.text: Because of COVID, had to go to WFH set up. Decided to try this keyboard/mouse before investing in a 2nd meter for my laptop. It was a game changer and much cheaper than 2nd screen. After getting this, I was able to return back to my usual type speed/productivity. Both items seem solid and I've already dropped them without issue. I am not noticing any delay in typing that some of the other reviews noted. This is a great low cost option for people looking to improve their WFH situation.
customer_reviews.author: stationeryenthusiast

customer_reviews.title: An OK Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keys and sound during typing are like most good quality keyboards. But I got a problem that for so many times, I would accidentally press the cap-lock key. It might be my own problem, but I never had so frequent and many times with the cap-lock key on other keyboards I used in the past 20-some years.
customer_reviews.author: Drizzling Seattle

customer_reviews.title: The mouse wheel is awful
customer_reviews.text: If you use the mouse wheel at all, I beg you to look elsewhere. The mouse wheel is so flimsy and bad. It requires almost no pressure to scroll. You will scroll in one direction, and then the pressure of your finger resting on the scroll wheel causes it to scroll back in the opposite direction. Sometimes you'll be just scrolling up a web page, and one single roll of the mouse wheel causes the page to scroll up, back down, and then back up again. It feels like you've been using it for 5 years, right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Some random guy

customer_reviews.title: Missing Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Got 3 starts because the keyboard is what I expected it to be. A simple but effective Logitech keyboard. However the product was advertised as a combo pack to include a mouse and the mouse was not included. I did not return because I needed the keyboard for work and had a back up mouse. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Magen Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Letters Start Coming off After 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these keyboards several years ago and loved it. So when it came time to replace it, I decided I'd get the same one. However, after only 3 months, the letters are already coming off the keys. It's still a great keyboard and a good value, but you may want to consider investing in a $5 set of letter stickers at some point!
customer_reviews.author: DIANA C GLEATON

customer_reviews.title: Mushy Keys But Otherwise Fine
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fine, but the feel of the keys is mushy compared to the others I routinely use. I find the stiffer, shorter throw keyboards allow me to type faster. I'm constantly correcting typos when I use this one. The right arrow key also feels different than the others. The mouse is a basic mouse. I'm keeping that for a backup when one of my other mice fails.
customer_reviews.author: SquareKnot

customer_reviews.title: Basic keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've always trusted Logitech for my keyboard and mouse needs. This is a good basic set that feels study and good. It's not sexy, but it gets the job done. This is definitely not a gaming set. I am not even sure why they put this question in. It's a good basic high quality set.
customer_reviews.author: klulu

customer_reviews.title: great combo at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set. The keyboard is water proof which is awesome . I have actually spilled a lot of liquids on keyboard and it just keeps working perfectly. The mouse is not bad but not great for gaming. This set is perfect for office or home use. I always purchase this combo when I need a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost Keyboard.. Mouse not so much
customer_reviews.text: I didnt expect a lot from this combo. I really only needed the keyboard and that part is GREAT! Good tactile feedback off key presses. However the included mouse leaves very much to be desired. It feels far flimsier than the keyboard. I did try it out but I pretty much just tossed it to the side and brought out my spare wireless mouse I had from an old laptop.
customer_reviews.author: A.Kunetka

customer_reviews.title: It's not fancy but it works.
customer_reviews.text: After ordering all the parts for my first gaming pc in 2015, I went cheap with the mouse and keyboard because I was on a budget and wanted to put most of my money into the pc itself. I usually just stick to singleplayer, non-competitive games and the MK120 worked well enough. I still have this mouse and keyboard combo in a drawer as a backup incase my G303 or Corsair K70 stop working.
customer_reviews.author: That girl with the face

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I like the Logitech keyboard as the keys have a good touch as I type. I haven't used it for gaming yet, or volume control. I haven't used it enough to decide on ergonomics. I gave 4 stars to each category due past positive experiences with products from the Logitech brand. I reserve the right to increase or decrease the star rating. The mouse works great. I recommend this package deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: If you're only playing games, then please save your money and get this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I play games with this and its fantastic. Honestly there is absolutely no need to buy those overpriced "gamer keyboards". WASD and all other buttons here work just fine and its pretty durable. The mouse is pretty good too but I can totally understand if you want to buy a gaming mouse as those do have a few advantages. But the keyboard is perfect for gaming. You're throwing away money if you spend more than this to get a "better keyboard". If you're only playing games, then please save your money and get this keyboard. The mouse is sufficient as well.
customer_reviews.author: TAEHSAEN

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Product
customer_reviews.text: OS: Windows 10 Pro x64 v1909 I purchased this keyboard and mouse combo because I need new ones for the eMachines desktop I restored to factory to sell. Everything with the keyboard and mouse itself worked great, no driver issues and Logitech always makes great quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: good product, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Tried the Verbatim keyboard/mouse combo but had problems with W10 compatibility on my 7 year old computer. And the mouse was way too small. A Monoprice keyboard was ok but somewhat too small. I like the size and feel of this keyboard. The mouse I find a little too small, but not a deal breaker. Amazingly hard to adjust to any new keyboard/mouse, but this seems the best for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at a low price point
customer_reviews.text: This wired keyboard and mouse are an inexpensive duo that work great for general use computing. At this price point I really can't complain considering they both function perfectly, but a buyer needs to consider the distance from the computer and where the keyboard and mouse will be as the cords are fairly short. My computer sits right under my keyboard and mouse so this was not a problem, but I barely had enough length of cord to make the connection.
customer_reviews.author: The art guy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with reliability, not style
customer_reviews.text: Basic keyboard and mouse. Durable, and works right out of the box. Wired, so it’s reliable for maintaining old computers, which is what I use it for. Looking for a good set of wired peripherals? This fits the bill and inexpensive as well. Work horse keyboard, not something to wow everyone, but that’s what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: it's cheap, but it's Logitech, so it's good
customer_reviews.text: I thought about giving it four stars, since it felt a bit cheap, and then I remembered how much I paid for the set. I wouldn't trust anybody besides Logitech to sell such an inexpensive mouse and keyboard. These work well, and I suspect that they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, effective, with puffy keys
customer_reviews.text: This is what is known as a $15 keyboard. It works. It doesn't have any bells and whistles. It's like a hammer. It does it's job, cheaply and relatively effectively. The one thing to truly note is that the keys are what I would consider "classically raised." Most modern keyboards have slightly lower, flatter keys popularized by Apple back with the iMacs. The keys on this MK120 are fully raised and "puffy" in the vein of the more classic keyboards of old. Buy accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Haon the GreatTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a cheap keyboard for work because the keyboard at work was disgusting and used by so many people with food crumbs all over it. This was perfect it’s exactly what I need and it doesn’t make those loud ticking noises every time you press on the keyboard. Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.author: Dana Tahhan

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard good mouse broken trash
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was perfect. Mouse was unusable. All in all a wash. Needed it so didn't return it. The mouse cable was missing wired and sticking out of the side and prevented it from clicking. I tried to open it up and fix it but the interior guides were broken so it was trash. Glad to have the Keyboard though.
customer_reviews.author: kate kipling

customer_reviews.title: moves like super fast
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a different brand - big name - and was getting so frustrated with what seemed, either it was too sensitive with the mouse, or maybe my PC was having problems beyond what the maintenance system I used could address. Since I had ordered this set some time ago as a spare, I switched it. Wow! What a difference. I see now the previous wasn't sensitive enough, nor the problems were my PC. This Logitech is crisp, moves like super fast, and I have none of the problems that have "plagued" me before. I decided even the smooth "roll" is much better than the "click" one, too. This price makes it all the more "excellent"
customer_reviews.author: R. Heiss

customer_reviews.title: Received keyboard and no mouse
customer_reviews.text: Received two keyboards and no mouse, not worth the trouble to try and explain to the elderly person I bought it for who lives out of state how to go through the mess it was going to take to get a new mouse. I'll just buy a mouse and have it shipped to her.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Trash mouse. Literally broken before package was opened
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this would’ve been a great product, but unfortunately the mouse came glitched and was not working. Packaging was fine so obviously they don’t test the mouses to see if they work before putting it in the box. The mouse wouldn’t move anywhere you wanted it to on the screen. Used an older mouse I had to check and the older mouse worked fine. I really only needed the keyboard but a cheap mouse to go with it would’ve been nice. Maybe a little too cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Mouse cord was stripped
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was fine but mouse sent was unusable. Someone else opened it and when i saw it I threw the mouse away thinking it was old and damaged. Found out later it was the new one that came out of the box that way. Since I threw it away couldn't return it. Unreal they would ship something so clearly unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great basic keyboard for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my laptop which i propped up, figured i could not go wrong to get this for the price even though it is not cordless. Anyway it does its job, the keyboard feels good on the fingers, keys do not jump, etc...worth the cost of it.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: I hate the "ALT" KEY
customer_reviews.text: This is the first keyboard I have ever had that for some reason the "alt" key seems to get in the way of my typing. Never in almost 20 years of typing have I had to clear my screen at a minimum of 2 or 3 times a day because while typing I guess I "touch" the "alt" key and it activates some program (it chooses which one to activate)... and I have to stop doing what I'm doing to clear the screen.. I won't purchase this keyboard again. Looks great, types great, but, hate the "alt" key.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Lundy

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard out there for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a real full size keyboard, not one of those chiclet keyboards that are practically worthless. I have been using Logitech K120s for years. Can't beat the quality and price, plus this one included a mouse which I don't need right now, but I'll keep it for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Early 2000s keyboard for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a real keyboard and mouse to set my online teaching. This was the right price. It is light and works great. Not too much clacking of the keys and the mouse is smooth enough. For cheap I say its worth the money. I want nicer but, it is what it is. Wish the cords were longer, but that might not matter depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: V. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A bit clacky
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple wired keyboard and this is exactly that. I type very lightly and I found I was missing letters because I wasn't pushing hard enough. It's a bit clacky and noisy, and a bit more difficult to type on that I wanted. I returned it but that was personal preference not because there was anything wrong with it per se
customer_reviews.author: Minianici

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little guy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect simple mouse and keyboard. Perfect for people looking for nothing fancy and to just get the job done. I was using my husband's gaming keyboard prior to this which is a lot larger so this needed some getting used to. I wouldn't use this for gaming but definitely for work related/office related typing. Its simple as keyboards used to be. I am happy with my purchase and you cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: annaskep

customer_reviews.title: Using it to type this review
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time at my computer. When my old keyboard began having problems I went online and found this Logitech keyboard at a very good price. It arrived very quickly and solved my problems. The old keyboard went in the junk and this one is doing well. Recomended
customer_reviews.author: Fred Howe

customer_reviews.title: I like the big bright high contrast lettering on the keys
customer_reviews.text: I like the big bright high contrast lettering on the keys. Doesn't have the extra function keys (speaker volume, calculator) that the Amazon Basics has but I like the feel of this keyboard much better and the mouse is almost as good as the Amazon Basics. It's new; if it holds up, it's a great value. Watch the packaging - you must open both ends of the box; the keyboard is in a separate compartment from the mouse. I've bought 5 keyboards and mice recently and this combo I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard fine, mouse sucks
customer_reviews.text: My older keyboard was worn out and dirty so it was time to replace. New MK120 works fine. My spelling has not improved! But the M110 mouse I had was also worn so I thought to replace it. The mouse that came with the keyboard does not work well. The response is jerky. I have checked for driver updates and rebooted to no avail. Crappy mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Beanland

customer_reviews.title: Feels fantastic--yet so inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second favorite keyboard of all time. My favorite was like 30 years ago connected to an old mainframe computer--a keyboard built probably by IBM and built to last for 100 years even though that computer itself was obsolete in 1 year. The irony! Anyway, this is no cheap keyboard. You will type faster and for more hours than you thought possible.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: This is not the keyboard for me.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the keyboard. It's noisy with clicking and has stiff keys. It feels and sounds like an old fashioned keyboard. These issues may be unique to me. Durability doesn't seem to a problem. The item arrived on time and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: DT Biggie

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes Old is Good!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dell laptop and I hate the keyboard. I have typed for over 40 years and cannot get used to it so when I saw an old fashioned keyboard for such a reasonable price I bought it and I wish that I had done it sooner. I love it. I am actually getting me speed up again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, at a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the keys much better than the laptop's keyboard. Just plug it in and start typing. I am not a great typist. I am a hunt and peck typist, and this keyboard is much better for my typing style than the keyboard of my laptop. The separate keyboard allows me to elevate the laptop for better eye contact but keep the keyboard at a level comfortable for typing. Works great glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Horseracer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard. It took awhile to get use to the noise and the clicky feel. When I first used it, I had a hard time adjusting it to where I didn’t feel pain in my wrists. When I type, it’s comfortable but noisy( which is okay). I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: Worse than my Dell Keyboard I was trying to replace
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is just cheap. Lounds keystrokes. Bulky keys that you have to press down with force. Just a horrible horrible keyboard. I tried it out, put it back in the box, and put it on the shelf for a backup keyboard. What a waste of $15.
customer_reviews.author: JBI

customer_reviews.title: High quality key board and mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has the feel of quality about it. I bought it for my new DAW (Digital Audio workstation). DAWS require a very precise mouse for audio editing. This unit delivers. I note the cheaper unit has issues. Just spend the extra $5 on this unit, and I bet you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. F. Mark Carter

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. I needed a cheap mouse keyboard to get a PC up and running. Mouse wire was not even enclosed properly, never worked. Keyboard is ok.... just a cheap keyboard. This never should have left the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: B Simon

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but they take the abuse
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing fancy here. No special buttons, standard optical wheel mouse, USB cords. As basic as it gets, and the price is nice for the set. I like this better than the basic Dell KB and mouse that comes with the Optiplex computers, and the mice don't crap out nearly as often. We use these in an industrial environment, so we need something cheap that can tolerate some abuse, as we replace KB / Mice a lot. These work great, and last a lot longer and are made better than the generic really cheap brands. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: psil303

customer_reviews.title: Good price and functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good price and functionality. This is a good basic keyboard. I couldn't believe my old keyboard didn't have arrow keys, but this one does. I'm not sure how well this will hold up in a gaming environment. Like I said, a good basic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: BronzeOwl

product_meta.title: Logitech Desktop MK120 Durable, Comfortable, USB Mouse and keyboard Combo
product_meta.description:
Logitech desktop Mk120. A durable Duo that brings comfort, style, and simplicity together. You'll be comfortable with the keyboard thanks to the low-profile, whisper-quiet keys and standard layout with full-size f-keys and number pad. With its thin profile, spill-resistant design,* durable keys that can withstand up to 10 million keystrokes** and sturdy, adjustable tilt legs, this sleek keyboard not only looks and feels good—it’s built to last. Plus, it's got easy-to-read keys. The high-definition optical Mouse puts comfort and control in your hands with smooth, accurate tracking and a comfortable, ambidextrous shape. And setup is simple—you just plug your keyboard and mouse into USB ports and start using them right out of the box.

* tested under limited conditions (Maximum of 60 ml liquid spillage). do not immerse keyboard in liquid.

** excludes number lock key.
feature_bullets: Comfortable low-profile keys and standard keyboard layout with full-size F-keys and number pad
Sleek and sturdy spill-resistant design* (*Tested under limited conditions—maximum of 60 ml liquid spillage. Do not immerse keyboard in liquid.)
High-definition optical mouse for smooth, accurate cursor control
Easy-to-read keys with bold, bright white characters
Simple wired USB connection—works with Windows-based PCs and Linux

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,971 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
